intro: Psilostrophe biennis, commonly known as the two-year old plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. It is a biennial plant, meaning it completes its life cycle over two growing seasons, typically flowering and producing seeds in its second year. Native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun. The plant features a taproot system and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional herbal medicine for various ailments.
